txt.en:
'Always you press forwards, [placeholder], eager to accept new challenges and face new evils; but there is value in remembering your past deeds. From them, you can learn much!

'Do you remember your assault on the fell prison of Sammath Baul? Horrors you braved there, and many dangers overcame, to free Laerdan from tortures of mind and body too terrible to imagine.

'Peer into the Reflecting Pool and experience this memory anew, [placeholder]. You will find that recalling your past may do you much good in the present.'
'I am pleased that you have revisited your experience freeing Laerdan from Sammath Baul, [placeholder]. Only through study of our past deeds can we gain knowledge that will aid us in the future.'
'Look into the Reflecting Pool and meditate upon your past deeds....'
'Look into the Reflecting Pool and meditate upon your past deeds....'
A Sage of Eriador has invited you to recollect your experience freeing Laerdan from the terrible prison of Sammath Baul.
Peer into the Reflecting Pool and revisit 'Laerdan's Escape'

The Reflecting Pool in Aughaire will allow you to revisit 'Laerdan's Escape.'\n\nA Sage of Eriador has challenged you to revisit your experience freeing Laerdan from Sammath Baul by using the Reflecting Pool in Aughaire.

A Sage of Eriador is by the Reflecting Pool in Aughaire.\n\nA Sage of Eriador in Aughaire is waiting to discuss what you have learned from revisiting your experience freeing Laerdan from Sammath Baul.
